meanings.definition: A woman serving on a jury.
meanings.sent1: The jurywoman listened attentively to the evidence presented in court.
meanings.sent2: The jurywoman deliberated with her fellow jurors to reach a verdict.
meanings.sent3: The jurywoman accidentally spilled her coffee during a break in the trial, causing a brief commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her role as a jurywoman was like being a detective, piecing together clues to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent5: The image of the jurywoman taking notes diligently during the trial stayed with the spectators.

meanings.definition: A female member of a jury.
meanings.sent1: During the trial, the jurywoman carefully considered the facts before making her decision.
meanings.sent2: The jurywoman was selected randomly to serve on the jury for the high-profile case.
meanings.sent3: The jurywoman shared a light-hearted moment with the bailiff during a recess.
meanings.sent4: As a jurywoman, she held the power to influence the outcome of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the jurywoman in the courtroom added a sense of fairness to the proceedings.
